DOC.brief_summary: To compare tear film differences between surgical eyes and nonsurgical eyes in patients who had cataract surgery by phacoemulsification in one eye.
DOC.detailed_description: All participants granted their written informed consent to participate in the research protocol.
DOC.criteria: agerelated cataract without surgery history and dry eye symptoms history diseases influencing tear secretion (such as Sj√∂gren syndrome, SteveJohnson syndrome, diabetes, thyroid disease, etc.); history of ocular surgeries or nuclear hardness IV and V, which required the use of larger phacoemulsification energy; use of drugs that affect tear secretion and stability (such as glaucoma medications, artificial tears, corticosteroid drugs, etc.); or presence of ocular diseases (such as Pterygium, blepharitis, uveitis, glaucoma, lacrimal apparatus, etc.).
